bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, February 4, 1880

div1.p: Reed explains how he forgot to mail McPherson's letter and is holding his mail for him. Reed's family will not rejoin him.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, February 4, 1880
div1.p:
The mail is post
here- I answer, at once, as it
leaves tomorrow morning- In the
first place, concerning your
Duplicate Return- May I be
shot, hung & drawn, Dorsey,
if I didn't neglect to send that
paper off! As soon as you
left, I “took it” & put it aside
just where I thought I would
be sure that I would find
remember it and mail it, the
following week- And until
your letter arrived & I found
the papers just where I
put there, I would have sworn
that I had forwarded them!
Even Mr Alberti remembered
distinctly of mailing them!
But, you must “exsqueeze”
me this time, Dorsey- I have
sent them to the Med. Director
by this mail- Some of your
Quarterly reports have
returned here- Your “physician's
Hand Book for 1880” is here-
I forgot to tell you. I ret=
=egraphed you the number of
Your order- S. O. No. 62-May
19th 1879- The scarf-pin from
Lucas has not been received,
but as pack-mules have gone
to St. Joseph's for mail, I think
it very likely that it will Come
next Monday when they re=
turn- Will write you by next
mail- I have opened the bundle
sent by your sister, & find the fol=
=lowing: a pretty, large Cravat
with card, bearing words, “To Dorsey
from George”- a beautiful hanging
pocket, containing a nice wisp-broom
with card, “to Dorsey from Nettie-
a Merry Christmas”- And a small
mat, with card, “To Brother Dorsey
from Nannie”- Now, there you
have it in a nutshell! I have
put them away safely for you-
I write in great haste, to give
me time to write other letters-
I shall not bring my wife
back, so that the matter referred
to in my 1st letter, is no longer
of importance. Best love to Tommy
Maurmy & Mr-Mills- Write
by return mail- All well
& send regards-
